result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenden P. PETERSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC w/Intent to deliver as repeater (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant has entered into a payment plan agreement with the Clerk of Court Office.

Payment Plan requested for monthly payment of $50.00; payment plan documents filed with case.

ADDRESS INFO for Brenden P. PETERSON
Current: 2029 14TH Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: 2310 Washington Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Order for Arrest and Commitment on Failure to Pay costs issued.  Defendant to be committed to the county jail until costs have been paid, not to exceed ten (10) days consecutive to any other sentence or commitment imposed.
Reminder Notice - Final Notice
Letter from JLF to deft.
Letter from deft to JLF.

Default Judgment.
It is hereby ordered that the $1,015.00 previously seized be forfeited to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Office and disposed of in accordance with Chapter 961 of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
(Note attached from Judge Fox.  Since this money cannot be used to pay the court costs in this matter as previously ordered, the Court will give the defendant 60 days to pay from his release from jail, or 10 days county jail for failure to pay, consecutive to any other time he is ordered to serve.  Jail indicated defendant's release date is 05-11-15, so the court costs will be due on 07-11-15.  Reminder notice mailed to defendant at the county jail)
Letter from ADA Vendetti to JLF.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Defendant in custody on another matter.
Count 1 - Possess THC with Intent to Deliver as repeater - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, possess drug paraphernalia.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for four (4) months, under the Huber Law, consecutive to sentences imposed on Case Nos. 14 CF 52 and 15 CF 53.  $518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid frmo defendant's forfeiture action.(14 CV 405)

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-14-14 at 2:15 p.m.  Plea date is set for 10-20-14 at 9:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-16-14 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
RE:  Posess THC with intent to deliver as repeater, on 08-17-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC with intent to deliver and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on probation hold.
